name.description: IoT Transport Stream setting name.

enable.description: Whether to enable the IoT Transport Stream setting.

serverUrl.description: If the service type is http, the server URL must start with http://.

serverType.description: The server type should be a value as follows: [0: http].

deviceClasses.description:
Supports protocol-based filtering during IoT data reporting processes.
The device class list should contain the value as follows: [0:minew; 1:iBeacon; 2:Eddystone].

items.description:
Supports protocol-based filtering during IoT data reporting processes.
The device class list should contain the value as follows: [0:minew; 1:iBeacon; 2:Eddystone].

reportInterval.description: Data reporting interval configuration for AP devices in IoT systems.The parameter [reportInterval] should be within the range of 13600 in seconds.

authentication.description: The parameter [authentication] should be a value as follows:[0:Use Token].

accessToken.description:
This parameter becomes mandatory when the authentication method is set to "Use Token".
Note:The parameter [clientId] should be 1 ~ 128 characters.

clientId.description:
This parameter becomes mandatory when the authentication method is set to "Use Token".
Note:The parameter [clientId] should be 1 ~ 128 characters.

rssiFormat.description: The signal strength reporting format currently supports five types: [0:Average; 1:Max; 2:Last; 3:Smooth; 4:Bulk].

filtersType.description:
User-defined settings to manage AP device filtering rules for IoT devices.
The parameter [filtersType] should contain the value as follows:[0:Company Identifier; 1:Vendor; 2:Local Name; 3:Service UUID; 4:Mac Oui; 5:iBeacon UUID; 6:UID; 7:URL].

items.description:
User-defined settings to manage AP device filtering rules for IoT devices.
The parameter [filtersType] should contain the value as follows:[0:Company Identifier; 1:Vendor; 2:Local Name; 3:Service UUID; 4:Mac Oui; 5:iBeacon UUID; 6:UID; 7:URL].

additionalProperties.description:
The keys in the [filters] map represent the filter types, while the values correspond to the specific filtering criteria or values associated with each filter type.
Note:
Filter type = 0, The Company Identifier must conform to a 4-digit or 6-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to ibeacon devices
Filter type = 1, The Vendor should not exceed 255 bytes in length.
Filter type = 2, The Local Name should not exceed 120 bytes in length. It is only applicable to minew devices.
Filter type = 3, The Service UUID must conform to a 4-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to minew and eddystone devices.
Filter type = 4, The Mac Oui must conform to a 6-digit hexadecimal encoding.
Filter type = 5, The iBeacon UUID must conform to a 32-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to iBeacon devices.
Filter type = 6, The UID must conform to a 20-digit or 32-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to eddystone devices.
Filter type = 7, The URL should not include a scheme. It is only applicable to eddystone devices.

items.description:
The keys in the [filters] map represent the filter types, while the values correspond to the specific filtering criteria or values associated with each filter type.
Note:

Filter type = 1, The Vendor should not exceed 255 bytes in length.
Filter type = 2, The Local Name should not exceed 120 bytes in length. It is only applicable to minew devices.
Filter type = 3, The Service UUID must conform to a 4-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to minew and eddystone devices.
Filter type = 4, The Mac Oui must conform to a 6-digit hexadecimal encoding.
Filter type = 5, The iBeacon UUID must conform to a 32-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to iBeacon devices.
Filter type = 6, The UID must conform to a 20-digit or 32-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to eddystone devices.
Filter type = 7, The URL should not include a scheme. It is only applicable to eddystone devices.

countOnly.description: A switch that controls whether the AP device exclusively reports the count of IoT devices.

blePeriodicTelemetry.description: Whether to enable the BLE Periodic Telemetry. When disabled no periodic packets will be uploaded.

rawData.description: Whether to enable the BLE Data Forwarding. When enabled, the AP directly reports the Bluetooth packet rawData to the server.

agingTime.description:
The system automatically removes a device's registry entry if no data reports are received within a predefined aging period.
When format = 0, The parameter aging time should be within the range of 30-86400.
When format = 1, The parameter aging time should be within the range of 1-1440.
When format = 2, The parameter aging time should be within the range of 1-24.

format.description: The parameter [format] should be a value as follows: [0:second 1:minute; 2:hour]

channelWidthDeployEnable.description: Whether to enable channel width deployment.

exclude5gChEn.description: Whether to enable the Excluded 5GHz Channels function.

widthSelectEn.description: Whether to enable channel width selection.

name.description: The name of Gateway QoS Service should contain 1 to 64 characters.

protocol.description: The protocol of Gateway QoS Service should be a value as follows: 0: TCP, 1: UDP, 2: TCP/UDP, 3: ICMP, 4: Other.

sourceStartPort.description: The start port of Source Port Range. It must be less than the end port. It should be within the range of 0-65535 when protocol is 0(TCP), 1(UDP) or 2(TCP/UDP).

sourceEndPort.description: The end port of Source Port Range. It must be more than the start port. It should be within the range of 0-65535 when protocol is 0(TCP), 1(UDP) or 2(TCP/UDP).

destStartPort.description: The start port of Destination Port Range. It must be less than the end port. It should be within the range of 0-65535 when protocol is 0(TCP), 1(UDP) or 2(TCP/UDP).

destEndPort.description: The end port of Destination Port Range. It must be more than the start port. It should be within the range of 0-65535 when protocol is 0(TCP), 1(UDP) or 2(TCP/UDP).

type.description: The type cannot be null and should be within the range of 0-255 when protocol is 3(ICMP).

code.description: The code cannot be null and should be within the range of 0-255 when protocol is 3(ICMP).

protoNum.description: The protoNum cannot be null and should be within the range of 1-255 when protocol is 4(Other).

description.description: The description of Gateway QoS Service should contain 0 to 128 characters.

bindType.description: Type of LDAP bind. BindType should be a value as follows: 0: Simple Mode; 2: Regular Mode.

items.description: The Service ID list of Bonjour Service. Service ID is a string in "_A._B.local" format, where "A" can be lowercase letters/numbers/hyphens (-)/underscore (_), and "B" should be lowercase letters. For example: _a1._b.local.Up to 3 entries are allowed for the serviceIds list.

apn.description:
Access point name, only for apnType static, should contain 1 to 62 characters and should meet the following requirements:
    1. Only allow letters, numbers, hyphens and dots.
    2. Should not start with "rac", "lac", "sgsn" or "rnc" and end with ".gprs", ignoring case.
    3. Should not contain ".-", "-." and spaces.

deadInterval.description: The dead interval for the specified interface in seconds. This specifies how long a router will wait to see a neighbor router's Hello packets before declaring that the router is down. This parameter must be the same for all routers attached to a network. It should be within the range of 1-65535 seconds and the default is 40.

name.description: WLAN group name should contain 1 to 128 characters.

clone.description: Whether to clone SSID list from other WLAN group.

clonedWlanId.description: WLAN group ID that needs to be cloned. Parameter [clonedWlanId] should not be null when Parameter [clone] is true.

name.description: SSID name. It should contain 1 to 32 UTF-8 characters.

deviceType.description: SSID device type, identify which devices this SSID will take effect; The lowest bit indicates whether [EAP] is included, the second low bit indicates whether [Gateway] is included, 1 means included while 0 means not included; For example, 3(11) means that EAP/Gateway is enabled, 1(01) means that EAP is enabled.

band.description: SSID band. The lowest bit indicates whether 2.4G is included; the second lowest bit indicates whether 5G is included; the third lowest bit indicates whether 6G is included; 1 means included while 0 means not included. For example, 7(111) means that 2G/5G/6G are enabled; 1(001) means that 2G is enabled. (When 5G is includedit means 5G/5G1/5G2 are enabled.)

guestNetEnable.description: SSID guest network config status. True: enable, false: disable.

security.description: SSID security mode; Security should be a value as follows: 0: None; 2: WPA-Enterprise; 3: WPA-Personal; 4: PPSK without RADIUS; 5: PPSK with RADIUS.

broadcast.description: SSID broadcast config status. True: enable, false: disable.

vlanEnable.description: SSID VLAN config status. True: enable, false: disable.

vlanId.description: SSID VLAN ID. This field is required when Parameter [vlanEnable] is true; It should be within the range of 14094.

mloEnable.description: SSID MLO config status. True: enable, false: disable.

pmfMode.description: SSID PMF mode. It should be a value as follows: 1: Mandatory; 2: Capable; 3: Disable.

enable11r.description: SSID 802.11r config status. True: enable, false: disable.

hidePwd.description: If this field is true, the SSID password will be hidden.

greEnable.description: SSID EoGre Tunnel config status. True: enable, false: disable. This configuration can be enabled only when the [VPN - EoGre Tunnel] global config is enabled;(This configuration applies to the Pro Site of the Omada Pro Controller only).

prohibitWifiShare.description: SSID prohibitWifiShare config status. True: enable, false: disable.

radiusProfileId.description: This field represents RADIUS Profile ID. RADIUS Profile(RADIUS Profile Template) can be created using Create a new Radius profile(Create a new Radius profile template) interface, and RADIUS Profile ID(RADIUS Profile Template ID) can be obtained from Get Radius profile list(Get Radius profile template list) interface.

versionEnt.description: WPA-Enterprise version. This is necessary when the value of security is 2(WPA-Enterprise); It should be a value as follows: 1: WPA-Enterprise; 2: WPA2-Enterprise; 3: WPA/WPA2-Enterprise; 4.WPA3-Enterprise.

encryptionEnt.description: WPA-Enterprise encryption. This is necessary when the value of security is 2(WPA-Enterprise); It should be a value as follows: 1: Auto; 3: AES; 4: AES-GCM 256; 5:AES-CNSA; 6:CCMP_128; When versionEnt is WPA3-Enterprise, Parameter [encryptionEnt] must be AES/AES-GCM 256/AES-CNSA/CCMP-128, and if ssid only enable 6G or contains 6G and enable mlo, Parameter [encryptionEnt] can not be AES.

gikRekeyEntEnable.description: WPA-Enterprise SSID group key update period config status. True: enable, false: disable.

rekeyEntInterval.description: WPA-Enterprise SSID group key update period interval config. When the value of Parameter [intervalEntType] is 0(Seconds), it should be within the range of 30-86400; when the value of Parameter [intervalEntType] is 1(Minutes), it should be within the range of 1-1440; when the value of Parameter [intervalEntType] is 2(Hours), it should be within the range of 1-24.

intervalEntType.description: WPA-Enterprise SSID group key update period interval unit config. It should be a value as follows: 0: Seconds; 1: Minutes; 2: Hours.

nasIdMode.description: Indicates the status of nasid under enterprise-level encryption. It should be a value as follows: 0: default (TP LINK: MAC Address), 1: follow device name, 2: custom.

nasId.description: This field is necessary when the nasIdMode type is custom.

SsidEnterpriseSettingOpenApiVO.description: WPA-Enterprise SSID config. This is necessary when the value of security is 2(WPA-Enterprise).

ppskProfileId.description: This field represents PPSK Profile ID; This is necessary when the value of security is 4(PPSK without RADIUS); PPSK Profile(PPSK Profile Template) can be created using Create PPSK profile interface(Create PPSK profile template interface), and PPSK Profile ID(PPSK Profile Template ID) can be obtained from Get PPSK profiles list(Get PPSK profile templates list) interface.

radiusProfileId.description: This field represents RADIUS Profile ID; This is necessary when the value of security is 5(PPSK with RADIUS); RADIUS Profile(RADIUS Profile Template) can be created using Create a new Radius profile(Create a new Radius profile template) interface, and RADIUS Profile ID(RADIUS Profile Template ID) can be obtained from Get Radius profile list(Get Radius profile template list) interface.

macFormat.description: MAC address format. This is necessary when the value of security is 5(PPSK with RADIUS); It should be a value as follows: 0: aabbccddeeff; 1: aa-bb-cc-dd-ee-ff; 2: aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff; 3: AABBCCDDEEFF; 4: AA-BB-CC-DD-EE-FF; 5: AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF.

nasId.description: NAS ID. This is necessary when the value of security is 5(PPSK with RADIUS); It should contain 1 to 64 characters.

type.description: Authentication type. This is necessary when the value of security is 5(PPSK with RADIUS); It should be a value as follows: 0: Mac Auth(Generic Radius with bound MAC); 1: EKMS(This configuration applies to the Pro Site of the Omada Pro Controller only); 2: Generic Radius with unbound MAC(This configuration applies to the Pro Site of the Omada Pro Controller only).

SsidPpskSettingOpenApiVO.description: PPSK without RADIUS/PPSK without RADIUS SSID config. This is necessary when the value of security is 4(PPSK without RADIUS), 5(PPSK with RADIUS).

securityKey.description: WPA-Personal SSID password. This is necessary when the value of security is 3(WPA-Personal);It should contain 8-63 printable ASCII characters or 8-63 hexadecimal digits.

versionPsk.description: WPA-Personal version. This is necessary when the value of security is 3(WPA-Personal); It should be a value as follows: 1: WPA-PSK; 2: WPA2-PSK; 3: WPA/WPA2-PSK; 4: WPA3-SAE.

encryptionPsk.description: WPA-Personal encryption. This is necessary when the value of security is 3(WPA-Personal); It should be a value as follows: 1: Auto; 3: AES; When versionPsk is WPA3-SAE, Parameter [encryptionPsk] must be AES.

gikRekeyPskEnable.description: WPA-Personal SSID group key update period config status. True: enable, false: disable.

rekeyPskInterval.description: WPA-Personal SSID group key update period interval config. When the value of Parameter [intervalPskType] is 0 (Seconds), it should be within the range of 30-86400; when the value of Parameter [intervalPskType] is 1 (Minutes), it should be within the range of 1-1440; when the value of Parameter [intervalPskType] is 2 (Hours), it should be within the range of 1-24.

intervalPskType.description: WPA-Personal SSID group key update period interval unit config. It should be a value as follows: 0: Seconds; 1: Minutes; 2: Hours.

SsidPskSettingOpenApiVO.description: WPA-Personal SSID config. This is necessary when the value of security is 3(WPA-Personal), 4(PPSK without RADIUS), 5(PPSK with RADIUS).

type.description:
The call type to be forwarded. 0: All Incoming Calls - If this option is selected, all incoming calls will be forwarded.
1: Calls to the Telephone Number - If this option is selected, select a telephone number from the list. Any incoming calls to this number will be forwarded.
2: Calls to the Phone - If this option is selected, select a telephony device from the list. Any incoming calls to this device will be forwarded.
3: Calls from a Person in the Telephone Book - If this option is selected, select a contact from the list. Any incoming calls from this contact will be forwarded.
4: Calls from the Telephone Number - If this option is selected, enter a specific telephone number. Any incoming calls from this number will be forwarded.

toNumbers.description: Any incoming calls to these numbers will be forwarded.

items.description: Any incoming calls to these numbers will be forwarded.

toDevices.description: Any incoming calls to these devices will be forwarded.

items.description: Any incoming calls to these devices will be forwarded.

fromPersons.description: Any incoming calls from these contacts will be forwarded.

items.description: Any incoming calls from these contacts will be forwarded.

fromNumbers.description: Any incoming calls from these numbers will be forwarded.

items.description: Any incoming calls from these numbers will be forwarded.

destNumber.description: The Destination Telephone Number that incoming calls will be redirected to.

incomingCallsBlockingEnable.description: Enable incoming calls blocking or not. The default value is false.

outgoingCallsBlockingEnable.description: Enable outgoing calls blocking or not. The default value is false.

types.description: Incoming calls blocking types. 0 means specific number, 1 means anonymous number.

items.description: Incoming calls blocking types. 0 means specific number, 1 means anonymous number.

numberList.description: Field [numberList] is required when the value of field [types] contains 0.

items.description: Field [numberList] is required when the value of field [types] contains 0.

types.description: Outgoing calls blocking types. 0 means mobile, 1 means landline, 2 means long distance, 3 means international, 4 means calls with specific number prefix.

items.description: Outgoing calls blocking types. 0 means mobile, 1 means landline, 2 means long distance, 3 means international, 4 means calls with specific number prefix.

prefixList.description: Field [prefixList] is required when the value of field [types] contains 4.

items.description: Field [prefixList] is required when the value of field [types] contains 4.

OutgoingCallsBlockingVO.description: Outgoing calls blocking rules. Rules are valid if and only if parameter [outgoingCallsBlockingEnable] equals true.

skipConfirm.description: skipConfirm indicates whether to skip the query of the devices bound to call blocking profile. false: Not to skip the query. true: Skip the query and delete the call blocking profile corresponding to the profileId.

defaultLanguage.description:
The controller automatically adjusts the language displayed on the Portal page according to the system language of the clients.If the language is not supported, the controller will use the default language specified here.
1: en_US (English); 3: cs_CZ (esk); 4: de_DE (Deutsch); 5: da_DK (Dansk); 6: el_GR ();
7: fr_FR (Franais); 8: es_ES (Espaol); 9: nl_NL (Nederlands); 10: it_IT (Italiano); 11: pl_PL (Polski);
12: pt_PT (Portugus); 13: ru_RU (); 14: sv_SE (Svenska); 15: tr_TR (Trke);
16: ar_SA ( );
17: ja_JP (); 18: zh_TW (()); 19: th_TH (); 20: vi_VN (Ting Vit); 21: ko_KR ()

authType.description:
Auth Type, should be a value as follows:
0No Authentication; 1Simple Password;
2: External Radius Server; 4External Portal Server;
11Hotspot; 15: Ldap.

httpsRedirectEnable.description: With this option enabled, unauthenticated clients will be redirected to the Portal page when they are trying to browse HTTPS websites.

landingPage.description:
LandingPage enum: 1: Redirect to the original URL, 2: Redirect to Promotional URL, 3: Redirect to Logout Page.
With The Original URL selected, clients are directed to the URL they request for after they pass Portal authentication.
With The Promotional URL selected, clients are directed to the specified URL here after they pass Portal authentication.
With The Logout Page selected, clients are directed to the Portal Logout Page after they pass Portal authentication.

landingUrlScheme.description: If Parameter [landingPage] is 2(Redirect to Promotional URL),this Parameter is requested, content is http or https.

landingUrl.description: If Parameter [landingPage] is 2(Redirect to Promotional URL),this Parameter is requested.

wlanScheduleEnable.description: SSID WLAN schedule global config status. True: enable, false: disable.

action.description: 0 means radio off, indicating the Wi-Fi function is off during the selected period; 1 means radio on, indicating the Wi-Fi function is on during the selected period.

scheduleId.description: This field represents Time Range Profile ID. Time Range Profile can be created using Create time range profile interface, and Time Range Profile ID can be obtained from Get time range profile list interface.

downLimitEnable.description: Whether to limit downlink speed; This field is required when select custom setting. True: enable, false: disable.

downLimit.description: Downlink speed limit value. When the value of Parameter [downLimitType] is 0(Kbps), downLimit should be within the range of 110485760; when the value of Parameter [downLimitType] is 1(Mbps), downLimit should be within the range of 1-10240.

downLimitType.description: Downlink speed limit unit config; DownLimitType should be a value as follows: 0: Kbps; 1: Mbps.

upLimitEnable.description: Whether to limit uplink speed; This field is required when select custom setting. True: enable, false: disable.

upLimit.description: Uplink speed limit value. When the value of Parameter [upLimitType] is 0(Kbps), upLimit should be within the range of 110485760; when the value of Parameter [upLimitType] is 1(Mbps), upLimit should be within the range of 1-10240.

upLimitType.description: Uplink speed limit unit config; UpLimitType should be a value as follows: 0: Kbps; 1: Mbps.

profileId.description: This field represents RateLimit Profile ID. RateLimit Profile can be created using Create rate limit profile interface, and RateLimit Profile ID can be obtained from Get rate limit profile list interface.(The validity priority is higher than the custom setting)

rate2gCtrlEnable.description: Whether to enable 2.4GHz Data Rate Control

lowerDensity2g.description: 2.4GHz Data Rate Control lower density value(Unit: Mbps); It should be a value as follows: [1, 2, 5.5, 6, 9, 11, 12, 18, 24, 36, 48, 54].

higherDensity2g.description: 2.4GHz Data Rate Control higher density value(Unit: Mbps); It should be a value as follows: [54].

cckRatesDisable.description: Whether to disable 2G CCK Rates. If this field is true, Parameter [lowerDensity2g] can not enter the following values: [1, 2, 5.5, 11].

clientRatesRequire2g.description: Whether to require clients to use rates at or above the specified value of 2.4GHz Data Rate Control.

sendBeacons2g.description: Whether to enable send beacons at 1Mbps of 2.4GHz Data Rate Control.

rate5gCtrlEnable.description: Whether to enable 5GHz Data Rate Control.

lowerDensity5g.description: 5GHz Data Rate Control lower density value(Unit: Mbps); It should be a value as follows: [6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, 48, 54].

higherDensity5g.description: 5GHz Data Rate Control higher density value(Unit: Mbps); It should be a value as follows: [54].

clientRatesRequire5g.description: Whether to require clients to use rates at or above the specified value of 5GHz Data Rate Control.

sendBeacons5g.description: Whether to enable send beacons at 6Mbps of 5GHz Data Rate Control.

rate6gCtrlEnable.description: Whether to enable 6GHz Data Rate Control. Note: This field will no longer be supported since Omada Controller V5.14.30.

lowerDensity6g.description: 6GHz Data Rate Control lower density value(Unit: Mbps); It should be a value as follows: [6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, 48, 54].Note: This field will no longer be supported since Omada Controller V5.14.30.

higherDensity6g.description: 6GHz Data Rate Control higher density value(Unit: Mbps); It should be a value as follows: [54].Note: This field will no longer be supported since Omada Controller V5.14.30.

clientRatesRequire6g.description: Whether to require clients to use rates at or above the specified value of 6GHz Data Rate Control. Note: This field will no longer be supported since Omada Controller V5.14.30.

sendBeacons6g.description: Whether to enable send beacons at 6Mbps of 6GHz Data Rate Control. Note: This field will no longer be supported since Omada Controller V5.14.30.

multiCastEnable.description: Whether to enable multicast to unicast, which is disabled by default; true: enable, false: disable

channelUtil.description: This item indicates that when the channel utilization reaches the threshold, multicast will no longer be converted to unicast, the default threshold is 100, and the value should be within the range of 0-100.

arpCastEnable.description: Whether to enable ARP cast to unicast, which is disabled by default; true: enable, false: disable

ipv6CastEnable.description: Whether to enable IPv6 multicast to unicast, which is enabled by default; true: enable, false: disable

filterEnable.description: Whether to enable the multicast filter switch, which is disabled by default; true: enable, false: disable

filterMode.description: This item indicates the status of the filtering protocol, the lowest low bit indicates whether IGMP is enabled, the second low bit indicates whether MDNS is enabled, and the third low bit indicates whether Others is enabled; 1 means enable while 0 means disable. For example, 7(111) means that all are enabled, 1(001) means that only IGMP is enabled.

macGroupId.description: This field represents MAC Group Profile ID. MAC Group Profile can be created using Create a new group profile interface, and MAC Group Profile ID can be obtained from Get group profile list by type interface.

macFilterEnable.description: SSID MAC Filter global config status. True: enable, false: disable.

policy.description: SSID MAC Filter policy config mode; It should be a value as follows: 0: Deny List, 1: Allow List.

macFilterId.description: This field represents MAC Group Profile ID. MAC Group Profile can be created using Create a new group profile interface, and MAC Group Profile ID can be obtained from Get group profile list by type interface.

ouiProfileIdList.description: This field represents OUI Profile ID list. OUI Profile can be created using Create OUI profile interface, and OUI Profile ID can be obtained from Get OUI profile summary list interface(This configuration applies to the Pro Site of the Omada Pro Controller only).

items.description: This field represents OUI Profile ID list. OUI Profile can be created using Create OUI profile interface, and OUI Profile ID can be obtained from Get OUI profile summary list interface(This configuration applies to the Pro Site of the Omada Pro Controller only).

id.description:
EAP authentication parameter identifier.
Parameter id should be a value as follows: [2: None-EAP Inner Authentication Type; 3: Inner Authentication EAP Method Type; 5: Credential Type; 6: Tunneled EAP Method Credential Type]

value.description:
Authentication parameters.
When id = 2, parameter value should be a value as follows:[1:PAP;2:CHAP;3:MSCHAP;4:MSCHAPV2].
When id = 3, parameter value should be a value as follows:[0:None;1:Identity;2:Notification;5:One-Time Password (OTP);6:Generic Token Card (GTC);13:EAP-TLS;18:GSM Subscriber Identity Modules (EAP-SIM);21:EAP-TTLS;23:EAP-AKA Authentication;25:PEAP;28:CRYPTOCard;29:EAP-MSCHAP-V2]
When id = 5, parameter value should be a value as follows:[1:SIM;2:USIM;3:NFC Secure Element;4:Hardware Token;5:Softoken;6:Certificate;7:username/password;8:None;10:Vendor Specific]
When id = 6, parameter value should be a value as follows:[1:SIM;2:USIM;3:NFC Secure Element;4:Hardware Token;5:Softoken;6:Certificate;7:username/password;9:Anonymous;10:Vendor Specific].

AuthenticationParamOpenApiVO.description:
Authentication Param list, configure the EAP authentication parameter identifier and authentication parameters.
Note: Up to 4 entries are allowed for the Authentication Param list.

method.description:
EAP authentication method supported by the NAI realm.
Parameter method should be a value as follows:[0:None;1:Identity;2:Notification;5:One-Time Password (OTP);6:Generic Token Card (GTC);13:EAP-TLS;18:GSM Subscriber Identity Modules (EAP-SIM);21:EAP-TTLS;23:EAP-AKA Authentication;25:PEAP;28:CRYPTOCard;29:EAP-MSCHAP-V2]

param.description:
Authentication Param list, configure the EAP authentication parameter identifier and authentication parameters.
Note: Up to 4 entries are allowed for the Authentication Param list.

EapMethodOpenApiVO.description:
EAP Method list.
Note: Up to 4 entries are allowed for the EAP Method list.

value.description:
Public Land Mobile Network ID.
Note: It should be between 10000 and 999999.

PlmnIdOpenApiVO.description:
PLMN ID list, enter PLMN ID of 802.11u 3GPP cellular network.
Note: Up to 6 entries are allowed for the PLMN ID list.

name.description:
The name of the NAI realm. Usually the domain name of the service provider.
Note: It should contain 1 to 64 UTF-8 characters.

encoding.description:
Encoding format.
Parameter encoding should be a value as follows:[0:RFC4282;1:UTF-8].

eap.description:
EAP Method list.
Note: Up to 4 entries are allowed for the EAP Method list.

RealmOpenApiVO.description:
Add a profile to identify and describe a NAI (Network Access Identifier) realm accessible using the AP, and the method that this NAI realm uses for authentication.
Note: Up to 10 entries are allowed for the NAI Realm list.

value.description:
Roaming Consortium Operator Identifier.
Note: Roaming Consortium Oi should conform to XX-XX-XX or XX-XX-XX-XX-XX format(Hexadecimal).

RoamingConsortiumOiOpenApiVO.description:
Roaming Consortium Oi list, enter the 802.11u roaming organization identifiers.
Note: Up to 3 entries are allowed for the Roaming Consortium Oi list.

hotspotV2Enable.description:
Whether Hotspot2.0 is enabled.
If hotspot2.0 is disabled, other parameters in Hotspot2.0 will be invalid.

networkType.description:
Specify the 802.11u network type.
Parameter networkType should be a value as follows: [0: Private network; 1: Private network with guest access; 2: Chargeable public network; 3: Free public network; 4: Personal device network; 5: Emergency services only network; 14: Test or experimental; 15: Wildcard].

plmnId.description:
PLMN ID list, enter PLMN ID of 802.11u 3GPP cellular network.
Note: Up to 6 entries are allowed for the PLMN ID list.

roamingConsortiumOi.description:
Roaming Consortium Oi list, enter the 802.11u roaming organization identifiers.
Note: Up to 3 entries are allowed for the Roaming Consortium Oi list.

operatorDomain.description:
Enter the domain name of the hotspot operator.
For example, www.omadanetworks.com.

dgafDisable.description:
Whether to enable DGAF(downstream group-addressed forwarding) disable mode.
In DGAF disable mode, the AP will not forward downstream multicast and broadcast packets.

heSsid.description:
Homogenous Extended Service Set Identifier, it is used to identify the same type of ESS network set.
Note: HESSID should be consistent with one of the BSSIDs of the APs in the zone.

internet.description: Internet access support status (network reachability), which indicates that the network is allowed to access the Internet.

availabilityIpv4.description:
Available type information of IPv4 addresses.
Parameter availabilityIpv4 should be a value as follows: [0: Address type not available; 1: Public IPv4 address available; 2: Port-restricted IPv4 address available; 3: Single NATed private IPv4 address available; 4: Double NATed private IPv4 address available; 5: Port-restricted IPv4 address and single NATed IPv4 address available; 6: Port-restricted IPv4 address and double NATed IPv4 address available; 7: Availability of the address type is not known].

availabilityIpv6.description:
Available type information of IPv6 addresses.
Parameter availabilityIpv6 should be a value as follows: [0: Address type not available; 1: Address type available; 2: Availability of the address type not known].

operatorFriendly.description:
Hotspot network operator friendly name.
Note:Parameter operatorFriendly should contain between 1 and 64 visible ASCII characters, with no Spaces at the beginning and end, and Spaces in between.

realmList.description:
Add a profile to identify and describe a NAI (Network Access Identifier) realm accessible using the AP, and the method that this NAI realm uses for authentication.
Note: Up to 10 entries are allowed for the NAI Realm list.

group.description: Venue Group.Parameter group should be a value as follows: [0: Unspecified; 1: Assembly; 2: Business; 3: Educational; 4: Factory and Industrial; 5: Institutional; 6: Mercantile; 7: Residential; 8: Storage; 9: Utility and Miscellaneous; 10: Vehicular; 11: Outdoor]

type.description: Venue Type.When Venue Group = 0, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified]When Venue Group = 1, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Assembly;1: Arena;2: Stadium;3: Passenger Terminal (e.g., airport, bus, ferry, train station);4: Amphitheater;5: Amusement Park;6: Place of Worship;7: Convention Center;8: Library;9: Museum;10: Restaurant;11: Theater;12: Bar;13: Coffee Shop;14: Zoo or Aquarium;15: Emergency Coordination Center]When Venue Group = 2, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Business;1: Doctor or Dentist office;2: Bank;3: Fire Station;4: Police Station;5: Post Office;6: Professional Office;7: Research and Development Facility;8: Attorney Office]When Venue Group = 3, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Educational;1: School,Primary;2: School, Secondary;3: University or College;]When Venue Group = 4, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Factory and Industrial;1: Factory]When Venue Group = 5, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Institutional;1: Hospital;2: Long-Term Care Facility (e.g. Nursing home, Hospice, etc.);3: Alchohol and Drug Re-habilitation Center;4: Group Home;5: Prison or Jail;]When Venue Group = 6, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Mercantile;1: Retail Store;2: Grocery Market;3: Automotive Service Station;4: Shopping Mall;5: Gas Station;]When Venue Group = 7, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Residential;1: Private Residence;2: Hotel or Motel;3: Dormitory;4: Boarding House;]When Venue Group = 8, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Storage]When Venue Group = 9, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Utility and Miscellaneous]When Venue Group = 10, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Vehicular;1: Automobile or Truck;2: Airplane;3: Bus;4: Ferry;5: Ship or Boat;6: Train;7: Motor Bike;]When Venue Group = 11, type should be a value as follows:[0: Unspecified Outdoor;1: Muni-mesh Network;2: City Park;3: Rest Area;4: Traffic Control;5: Bus Stop;6: Kiosk]

name.description:
Networks venue name, identifying the physical location of the network.
Note: It should contain between 1 and 64 visible ASCII characters, with no Spaces at the beginning and end, and Spaces in between.

VenueInfoOpenApiVO.description: Indicates the venue information using the combination of the network's venue group and venue type (using the international building code).

name.description: SSID name. It should contain 1 to 32 UTF-8 characters.

band.description: SSID band. The lowest bit indicates whether 2.4G is included; the second lowest bit indicates whether 5G is included; the third lowest bit indicates whether 6G is included; 1 means included while 0 means not included. For example, 7(111) means that 2G/5G/6G are enabled; 1(001) means that 2G is enabled. (When 5G is includedit means 5G/5G1/5G2 are enabled.)

guestNetEnable.description: SSID guest network config status. True: enable, false: disable.

security.description: SSID security mode; Security should be a value as follows: 0: None; 2: WPA-Enterprise; 3: WPA-Personal; 4: PPSK without RADIUS; 5: PPSK with RADIUS.

oweEnable.description: Opportunistic Wireless Encryption, also known as Enhanced Open, is a certification provided by the Wi-Fi Alliance as part of the WPA3 wireless security standard. OWE will enable two wireless VAPs per radio, one for access of OWE-supported stations, and one for access of other stations. An SSID with OWE enabled will be counted as two SSID entries for 2G and 5G. Only for security is None and band contains 2.4G or 5G.

broadcast.description: SSID broadcast config status. True: enable, false: disable.

vlanEnable.description: SSID VLAN config status. True: enable, false: disable.

vlanId.description: SSID VLAN ID. This field is required when Parameter [vlanEnable] is true; It should be within the range of 14094.

mloEnable.description: SSID MLO config status. True: enable, false: disable.

pmfMode.description: SSID PMF mode. It should be a value as follows: 1: Mandatory; 2: Capable; 3: Disable.

enable11r.description: SSID 802.11r config status. True: enable, false: disable.

hidePwd.description: If this field is true, the SSID password will be hidden.

greEnable.description: SSID EoGre Tunnel config status. True: enable, false: disable; This configuration can be enabled only when the [VPN - EoGre Tunnel] global config is enabled.

prohibitWifiShare.description: SSID prohibitWifiShare config status. True: enable, false: disable.

type.description: The Type of the Internet port as follows: 0: WAN; 1: USB; 2: LTE; 3: DSL.

LteWanSettingOpenApiVO.description: The setting of the WAN lte.

emergencyNumberEnable.description: Whether to enable the emergency number.

noOperationTime.description: No operation time should be within the range of 2-8s.

items.description: Emergency number list.

type.description: Type must be gateway or ap

additionalProperties.description: The order in which items take effect, this object is a Map, the key is item ID and the value is the index you want to set.

indexes.description: The order in which items take effect, this object is a Map, the key is item ID and the value is the index you want to set.

blockPage.description: blockPage should be a value as follows: false: close; true: open.

blockPageMessage.description: blockPageMessage of blockPage,when blockPage switch is open.

safeSearch.description: safeSearch should be a value as follows: false: close; true: open.

countryCode.description: Country code should contain 2 characters. Country code must be entered when entering the calling code. For the values of Country code, refer to section 5.4.1 of the Open API Access Guide.

callingCode.description: Calling code should contain 2 to 5 characters. Calling code must be entered when entering the country code. For the values of Calling code, refer to section 5.4.1 of the Open API Access Guide.

name.description: Port name.

ip.description: Whether to query the port IP.

usage.description: Whether to query the port data usage.

command.description: To reboot the router via SMS, send a message starting with "LTE Router Reboot", followed by Password/PIN(e.g. LTE Router Reboot 1234). Password is required for the control of device restart via SMS.

rebootEnable.description: Whether to enable the control of device restart via SMS.

statusEnable.description: Whether to enable Viewing device-related information and WAN port-related information via SMS.

accessEnable.description: Whether to enable the allow list of the above functions, and only allow users in the list to interact with the device.

resource.description: The SMS router command setting creation resource, such as: 0: new created, 1: from template, 2: override.

command.description: To get status information from the router, send a message starting with "LTE Router Status", followed by Password/PIN(e.g. LTE Router Status 1234). The password is required for viewing device-related Information via SMS.

name.description: Whether to query device model name.

uptime.description: Whether to query device boot time.

version.description: Whether to query device firmware version.

mac.description: Whether to query device MAC address.

inboxPolicy.description: Policy parameter [inboxPolicy] should be from 0 to 2. 0: If SMS inbox/outbox is full, delete the oldest read SMS; 1: If SMS inbox/outbox is full, send e-mail alert to Administrator;2: If SMS inbox/outbox is full, Forward new SMS with e-mail to Administrator.

resource.description: SMS policy setting creation resource, such as: 0: new created, 1: from template, 2: override.

enable.description: whether to enable wan Settings Override

preOsgModel.description: select gateway model, you can query option from 'Get supported gateway model list for pre-configuration'. If already choose or adopted gateway,use current gateway model id.

wanPortNum.description: custom number of wan ports, only for preOsgModel at 2

portUuids.description: select wan ports to open, and other wan ports will be closed, you can get port uuid list from 'Get internet basic info'.

items.description: select wan ports to open, and other wan ports will be closed, you can get port uuid list from 'Get internet basic info'.

forceChange.description: Force change wan ports. If set true, wan ports will be modified without check, and the gateway will reboot. If set false, consequence will be checked and return check result.

skipConfirm.description: skipConfirm indicates whether to skip the query of "#'s conflict" of voip device settings. false: Not to skip the query. true: Skip the query and the device will give priority to the "end with #" configuration.

locale.description: The country code of telephone number.

dscpForSip.description: The dscp For Sip of telephone number.

dscpForRtp.description: The dscp For Rtp of telephone number.

dtmfRelaySetting.description: The dtmf relay setting of telephone number.

expirationTime.description: The expiration time of telephone number.

retryInterval.description: The retry interval of telephone number.

endWithNumberSign.description: Whether the telephone number setting end with number sign.

numberIdForOutgoingCalls.description: The outgoing calls number ID of voip device.

numberIdListForIncomingCalls.description: The list of incoming calls number ID.

items.description: The list of incoming calls number ID.

speakerGain.description: The speaker gain of voip device.

micGain.description: The mic gain of voip device.

callBlockingProfileId.description: The call blocking profile ID of voip device.When callBlockingEnable is true, it can not be null.

callBlockingProfileName.description: The call blocking profile name of voip device.

digitMapProfileId.description: The digit map profile ID of voip device.

digitMapProfileName.description: The digit map profile name of voip device.

needConfirm.description: needConfirm indicates whether the digit map configuration conflicts with the "end with #" configuration of the current device.

deleteTelephoneNumberIds.description: Telephone number IDs to be deleted.

items.description: Telephone number IDs to be deleted.

skipConfirm.description: skipConfirm indicates whether to skip the query of "#'s conflict" of voip device settings. false: Not to skip the query. true: Skip the query and the device will give priority to the "end with #" configuration.

locale.description: The country code of telephone number.

noAnswerTime.description: The no answer time of telephone number.

interfaceType.description: InterfaceType should be a value as follows: 0: WAN; 1: LAN; 2: Virtual WAN.

interfaceId.description: Interface ID, for example: if interfaceType is LAN network, interfaceId should be LAN network ID. LAN Network can be created using 'Create LAN network' interface, and LAN Network ID can be obtained from 'Get LAN network list' interface. When parameter [interfaceType] is 0 or 1, parameter [interfaceId] should not be empty.

virtualWanId.description: Virtual WAN ID, can be obtained from 'Query virtual WAN list' interface. When parameter [interfaceType] is 2, parameter [virtualWanId] should not be empty.

callBlockingProfileId.description: The call blocking profile ID of voip device.When callBlockingEnable is true, it can not be null.

callBlockingProfileName.description: The call blocking profile name of voip device.

numberIdForOutgoingCalls.description: The outgoing calls number ID of voip device.

numberIdListForIncomingCalls.description: The list of incoming calls number ID.

items.description: The list of incoming calls number ID.

speakerGain.description: The speaker gain of voip device.

micGain.description: The mic gain of voip device.

speakerGain.description: The speaker gain of voip device.

micGain.description: The mic gain of voip device.

callBlockingProfileId.description: The call blocking profile ID of voip device.When callBlockingEnable is true, it can not be null.

callBlockingProfileName.description: The call blocking profile name of voip device.

digitMapProfileId.description: The digit map profile ID of voip device.

digitMapProfileName.description: The digit map profile name of voip device.

items.description: Device MAC list.

skipConfirm.description: skipConfirm indicates whether to skip the query of "#'s conflict" of voip device settings. false: Not to skip the query. true: Skip the query and the device(s) will give priority to the "end with #" configuration.

noAnswerTime.description: The no answer time of telephone number. Parameter [noAnswerTime] should be from 5 to 60

voiceMailInUsb.description: Whether voice mail is in USB.

greetingForVoiceMailMode.description: Parameter [greetingForVoiceMailMode] should be 0 or 1. 0: Default, 1: Custom.

enable.description: Whether to enable voice mail settings.

remoteAccessEnable.description: Whether voice mail allows remote access.

provider.description: The telephony providers supported. The range is between 0 and 13. 0: Other Provider; 1: 1 & 1 Internet; 2: Congstar; 3: Vodafone/Arcor; 4: DUS.net; 5: Easybell; 6: Kabel Deutschland; 7: QSC/Q-DSL home; 8: Sipgate; 9: Sipgate Team; 10: Sipload; 11: Ventengo; 12: Telekom; 13: Bellsip. The default value is 0.

registrarAddress.description: When parameter [provider] is a value in[0, 6], parameter [registrarAddress] should not be null.

username.description: When parameter [provider] is a value in [0, 2, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13], parameter [username] should not be null.

dayMode.description: The days you want to block the incoming calls. 1-daily2-weekend3-weekday

timeBegin.description: The start time of the DND period you want to block incoming calls. It should be an integer value between 0 and 1438.

timeEnd.description: The end time of the DND period you want to block incoming calls. It should be an integer value between 1 and 1439.

incomingCallsBlockingEnable.description: Enable incoming calls blocking or not. The default value is false.

outgoingCallsBlockingEnable.description: Enable outgoing calls blocking or not. The default value is false.

status.description: The status of virtual WAN, valid values are true or false.

communityString.description:
Community string, valid when parameter [snmpV1V2CEnable] is true. The communityString should contain at least 10 characters, using a combination of numbers, letters or special characters. 
The communityString should not contain consecutive identical characters.

username.description: Username, valid when parameter [snmpV3Enable] is true. Username should contain 1 to 30 characters

password.description:
The password should contain at least 10 characters, using a combination of numbers, letters or special characters. 
The password should not contain consecutive identical characters. 
Username and Password should not be the same.

type.description: DNS proxy setting type. Type should be a value as follows: 0: DNSSEC, 1: DoH, 2: DoT

servers.description: DNS Server IP list, Up to 2 entries are allowed for the server list

items.description: DNS Server IP list, Up to 2 entries are allowed for the server list

replyPolicy.description: Bogus DNS reply policy type. ReplyPolicy should be a value as follows: 0: Pass, 1: Drop

DnsSecSettingOpenApiVO.description: DNS proxy DNSSEC setting, valid when parameter [type] is 0

name.description: Custom service name, should contain 1 to 64 characters

DohCustomizedServerOpenApiVO.description: Custom Service list. Up to 2 DoH default and custom Servers can be selected, setting the parameter [enable] to true indicates the selection of the custom server. Up to 8 custom servers can be configured

defaultServers.description: Preconfigured Server List. DefaultServers should be a value as follows: 0:Google, 1Cloudflare, 4CleanBrowsing, 5Quad9_1, 6: Quad9_2. Up to 2 DoH default and custom servers can be selected. For example, defaultServers : [0, 1] represents that you have selected default services Google and Cloudflare

items.description: Preconfigured Server List. DefaultServers should be a value as follows: 0:Google, 1Cloudflare, 4CleanBrowsing, 5Quad9_1, 6: Quad9_2. Up to 2 DoH default and custom servers can be selected. For example, defaultServers : [0, 1] represents that you have selected default services Google and Cloudflare

customizedServers.description: Custom Service list. Up to 2 DoH default and custom Servers can be selected, setting the parameter [enable] to true indicates the selection of the custom server. Up to 8 custom servers can be configured

DohSettingOpenApiVO.description: DNS proxy DoH setting, valid when parameter [type] is 1

name.description: Custom service name, should contain 1 to 64 characters

servers.description: Custom service IPs, up to 2 IPs can be configured

items.description: Custom service IPs, up to 2 IPs can be configured

DotCustomizedServerOpenApiVO.description: Custom Service list. Up to 2 DoT default and custom Servers can be selected, setting the parameter [enable] to true indicates the selection of the custom server. Up to 8 custom servers can be configured

defaultServers.description: Preconfigured Server List. DefaultServers should be a value as follows: 0:Google, 1Cloudflare, 2OpenDNS, 3Quad9, 4: CleanBrowsing. Up to 2 DoT default and custom servers can be selected. For example, defaultServers : [0, 1] represents that you have selected default services Google and Cloudflare

items.description: Preconfigured Server List. DefaultServers should be a value as follows: 0:Google, 1Cloudflare, 2OpenDNS, 3Quad9, 4: CleanBrowsing. Up to 2 DoT default and custom servers can be selected. For example, defaultServers : [0, 1] represents that you have selected default services Google and Cloudflare

customizedServers.description: Custom Service list. Up to 2 DoT default and custom Servers can be selected, setting the parameter [enable] to true indicates the selection of the custom server. Up to 8 custom servers can be configured

DotSettingOpenApiVO.description: DNS proxy DoT setting, valid when parameter [type] is 2

idInt.description: Entry ID of the policy. Except for newly added policies, this parameter should be retained

type.description: Type of the policy. It should be a value as follows: 3: Free auth client IP, and parameter [clientIp] is needed. 4: Free auth client MAC, and parameter [clientMac] is needed

clientMac.description: Free auth client MAC Address, for example: AA-AA-AA-AA-AA-AA

preAuthAccessEnable.description: Whether to enable Pre-Authentication Access. If parameter [preAuthAccessEnable] is true, parameter [preAuthAccessPolicies] is needed

freeAuthClientEnable.description: Whether to enable Free-Authentication Client. If parameter [freeAuthClientEnable] is true, parameter [freeAuthClientPolicies] is needed

idInt.description: Entry ID of the policy. Except for newly added policies, this parameter should be retained

type.description: Type of the policy. It should be a value as follows: 1: Destination IP Range, and parameter [ip] and [subnetMask] is needed. 2: URL, and parameter [url] is needed

ip.description: IP Address of Pre-Authentication Access

subnetMask.description: Subnet mask of Pre-Authentication Access. It should be within the range of 1-32

additionalProperties.description: The order in which items take effect, this object is a Map, the key is item ID and the value is the index you want to set.

indexes.description: The order in which items take effect, this object is a Map, the key is item ID and the value is the index you want to set.

aiRoamingEnable.description: Whether to enable AI roaming, this configuration will take effect only when fast roaming is enabled

dualBand11kReportEnable.description: Whether to enable 802.11k report. It has been deprecated.

forceDisassociationEnable.description: Whether to enable forced disassociation. Note: This field will no longer be supported since Omada Controller 5.14.24.40.

host.description: The IP address of the remote log server

port.description: Port of the remote log server, port should be within the range of 1-65535

enable.description: Whether to enable IDS/IPS config. If parameter[enable] is true, parameter[ipsMode] and parameter[dplevel] are needed

ipsMode.description: IpsMode should be a value as follows: 0: detect only; 1: detect and block

geoEnable.description: Whether to enable identifying the source country and destination country of attack ip addresses.

dpLevel.description: DpLevel should be a value as follows: 0: Low; 1: Medium; 2: High; 3: Custom

customCategories.description: Custom IDS/IPS categories list, if parameter[Dplevel] is 3, customCategories is needed.CustomCategories should be a list as follow: 1: Botcc, 2: Worm, 3: Malware, 4: Mobile_Malware, 6: P2P, 7: Tor, 8: Exploit, 9: Shellcode, 14: Activex, 15: DNS, 18: User Agents, 24: DShield

items.description: Custom IDS/IPS categories list, if parameter[Dplevel] is 3, customCategories is needed.CustomCategories should be a list as follow: 1: Botcc, 2: Worm, 3: Malware, 4: Mobile_Malware, 6: P2P, 7: Tor, 8: Exploit, 9: Shellcode, 14: Activex, 15: DNS, 18: User Agents, 24: DShield

timeRangeId.description: This field represents Time Range ID. Time Range can be created using 'Create time range profile' interface, and Time Range ID can be obtained from 'Get time range profile list' interface. If parameter[timeRangeId] is null, IDS/IPS will be effective in all time ranges.

type.description: Type should be a value as follow: 0: all traffic; 1: packet tracking

direction.description: Direction should be a value as follow: 0: both direction; 1: source direction; 2: destination direction

trafficType.description: TrafficType should be a value as follow: 0: ip address; 1: subnet

ip.description: IPS signature traffic Source. If parameter [trafficType] is 0, parameter [ip] is needed

subnet.description: IPS signature traffic Source. If parameter [trafficType] is 1, parameter [subnet] is needed

direction.description: The location of the target that can trigger the threat, direction should be a value as follows:0: both 1: source, 2: destination.

trafficType.description: Exempt the category of objects (targets) that can trigger the threat, trafficType should be a value as follows: 0: IP Address, 1: Network, 2: Subnet.

ipAddress.description: The value of the trafficType is 0, indicating IP address.

network.description: The value of the trafficType is 1, indicating LAN network ID.

subnet.description: The value of the trafficType is 2, indicating subnet.

enable.description: Parameter [enable] indicates whether to enable the multicast rate limiting function. True: on, false: off

arpPps.description: Parameter [arpPps] indicates the number of ARP packets allowed to pass per second.

ndPps.description: Parameter [ndPps] indicates the number of ND packets allowed to pass per second.

igmpPps.description: Parameter [igmpPps] indicates the number of IGMP packets allowed to pass per second.

dhcpPps.description: Parameter [dhcpPps] indicates the number of DHCP packets allowed to pass per second.

dhcpv6Pps.description: Parameter [dhcpv6Pps] indicates the number of DHCP v6 packets allowed to pass per second.

mdnsPps.description: Parameter [mdnsPps] indicates the number of MDNS packets allowed to pass per second.

otherBcastPps.description: Parameter [otherBcastPps] indicates the number of OTHER BROADCAST packets allowed to pass per second.

otherMcastPps.description: Parameter [otherMcastPps] indicates the number of OTHER MULTICAST packets allowed to pass per second.

defGatewayEnable.description: Connectivity detection, parameter defGatewayEnable should be a value as follows: true: Auto(Recommended) ; false: Customer IP

enable.description: Enable of the MAC filtering general setting.

vlan.description: When purpose is "VLAN" or purpose is "interface" and VLANType is 0, vlan should be within the range of 1-4090.

existDhcpNextServer.description: Whether DHCP Next Server has been configured.

id.description: The IoT Transport Stream entry ID.

name.description: IoT Transport Stream setting name.

enable.description: Whether to enable the IoT Transport Stream setting.

serverUrl.description: If the service type is http, the server URL must start with http://.

serverType.description: The server type should be a value as follows: [0: http].

deviceClasses.description:
Supports protocol-based filtering during IoT data reporting processes.
The device class list should contain the value as follows: [0:minew; 1:iBeacon; 2:Eddystone].

items.description:
Supports protocol-based filtering during IoT data reporting processes.
The device class list should contain the value as follows: [0:minew; 1:iBeacon; 2:Eddystone].

reportInterval.description: Data reporting interval configuration for AP devices in IoT systems.

authentication.description: The parameter [authentication] should be a value as follows:[0:Use Token].

accessToken.description:
This parameter becomes mandatory when the authentication method is set to "Use Token".
Note:The parameter [clientId] should be 1 ~ 128 characters.

clientId.description:
This parameter becomes mandatory when the authentication method is set to "Use Token".
Note:The parameter [clientId] should be 1 ~ 128 characters.

rssiFormat.description: The signal strength reporting format currently supports five types: [0:Average; 1:Max; 2:Last; 3:Smooth; 4:Bulk].

filtersType.description:
User-defined settings to manage AP device filtering rules for IoT devices.
The parameter [filtersType] should contain the value as follows:[0:Company Identifier; 1:Vendor; 2:Local Name; 3:Service UUID; 4:Mac Oui; 5:iBeacon UUID; 6:UID; 7:URL].

items.description:
User-defined settings to manage AP device filtering rules for IoT devices.
The parameter [filtersType] should contain the value as follows:[0:Company Identifier; 1:Vendor; 2:Local Name; 3:Service UUID; 4:Mac Oui; 5:iBeacon UUID; 6:UID; 7:URL].

additionalProperties.description:
The keys in the [filters] map represent the filter types, while the values correspond to the specific filtering criteria or values associated with each filter type.
Note:
Filter type = 0, The Company Identifier must conform to a 4-digit or 6-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to ibeacon devices
Filter type = 1, The Vendor should not exceed 255 bytes in length.
Filter type = 2, The Local Name should not exceed 120 bytes in length. It is only applicable to minew devices.
Filter type = 3, The Service UUID must conform to a 4-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to minew and eddystone devices.
Filter type = 4, The Mac Oui must conform to a 6-digit hexadecimal encoding.
Filter type = 5, The iBeacon UUID must conform to a 32-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to iBeacon devices.
Filter type = 6, The UID must conform to a 20-digit or 32-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to eddystone devices.
Filter type = 7, The URL should not include a scheme. It is only applicable to eddystone devices.

items.description:
The keys in the [filters] map represent the filter types, while the values correspond to the specific filtering criteria or values associated with each filter type.
Note:
Filter type = 0, The Company Identifier must conform to a 4-digit or 6-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to ibeacon devices
Filter type = 1, The Vendor should not exceed 255 bytes in length.
Filter type = 2, The Local Name should not exceed 120 bytes in length. It is only applicable to minew devices.
Filter type = 3, The Service UUID must conform to a 4-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to minew and eddystone devices.
Filter type = 4, The Mac Oui must conform to a 6-digit hexadecimal encoding.
Filter type = 5, The iBeacon UUID must conform to a 32-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to iBeacon devices.
Filter type = 6, The UID must conform to a 20-digit or 32-digit hexadecimal encoding. It is only applicable to eddystone devices.
Filter type = 7, The URL should not include a scheme. It is only applicable to eddystone devices.

Note:

countOnly.description: A switch that controls whether the AP device exclusively reports the count of IoT devices.

blePeriodicTelemetry.description: Whether to enable the BLE Periodic Telemetry. When disabled no periodic packets will be uploaded.

rawData.description: Whether to enable the BLE Data Forwarding. When enabled, the AP directly reports the Bluetooth packet rawData to the server.

name.description: Device name.

type.description: Device type.

ip.description: IP Address.

optimizeSuccess.description: Parameter [optimizeSuccess] indicates whether the optimization has been executed successfully.

support5g2.description: Parameter [support5g2] indicates whether the device supports 5 GHz-2.

failMsgType.description: Fail message type. -1: Success. 0: Failed to optimize device because of no scan result. 1: Failed to apply deploy config because the device is not connected or the configuration is invalid.

rcmdChanWidth.description: Channel width recommended by the algorithm.

rcmdPower.description: Power value recommended by the algorithm.

origBand.description: The original switch status of band. 0: off, 1: on.

rcmdBand.description: Band switch status recommended by the algorithm. 0: off, 1: on.

errCode.description: Error code returned by the algorithm. 0: OK. -34820: The configured bandwidth has no optional channel. -34821: The lowest power supported by this device is out of the configured Power Range. -34822: The highest power supported by this device is out of the configured Power Range. -34815: Failed to optimize device because of no scan result. -34816: Failed to apply deploy config because of this device is not connected. -34823: Cannot optimize the channels because you have excluded them.

channelWidthDeployEnable.description: Whether to enable channel width deployment.

time.description: Timestamp corresponding to the start of optimization.

currentConfig.description: 0: This entry does not correspond to the current configuration. 1: The recommended values are the current configuration. 2: The previous/origin values are the current configuration.

successDevices.description: The number of devices which have been successfully optimized.

failDevices.description: The number of devices which have been optimized unsuccessfully.

description.description: Description of family

name.description: WLAN group name should contain 1 to 128 characters.

primary.description: Whether it is the default WLAN group

name.description: SSID name. It should contain 1 to 32 UTF-8 characters.

band.description: SSID band. The lowest bit indicates whether 2.4G is included; the second lowest bit indicates whether 5G is included; the third lowest bit indicates whether 6G is included; 1 means included while 0 means not included. For example, 7(111) means that 2G/5G/6G are enabled; 1(001) means that 2G is enabled. (When 5G is includedit means 5G/5G1/5G2 are enabled.)

guestNetEnable.description: SSID guest network config status. True: enable, false: disable.

security.description: SSID security mode; Security should be a value as follows: 0: None; 2: WPA-Enterprise; 3: WPA-Personal; 4: PPSK without RADIUS; 5: PPSK with RADIUS.

broadcast.description: SSID broadcast config status. True: enable, false: disable.

vlanEnable.description: SSID VLAN config status. True: enable, false: disable.

vlanId.description: SSID VLAN ID. This field is required when Parameter [vlanEnable] is true; It should be within the range of 14094.

vlanPoolIds.description: SSID VLAN POOL IDs. This field is required when Parameter [vlanEnable] is true; The numbers contain in it should be within the range of 14094.

hotspotV2Enable.description:
Whether Hotspot2.0 is enabled.
If hotspot2.0 is disabled, other parameters in Hotspot2.0 will be invalid.

networkType.description:
Specify the 802.11u network type.
Parameter networkType should be a value as follows: [0: Private network; 1: Private network with guest access; 2: Chargeable public network; 3: Free public network; 4: Personal device network; 5: Emergency services only network; 14: Test or experimental; 15: Wildcard].

plmnId.description:
PLMN ID list, enter PLMN ID of 802.11u 3GPP cellular network.
Note: Up to 6 entries are allowed for the PLMN ID list.

roamingConsortiumOi.description:
Roaming Consortium Oi list, enter the 802.11u roaming organization identifiers.
Note: Up to 3 entries are allowed for the Roaming Consortium Oi list.

operatorDomain.description:
Enter the domain name of the hotspot operator.
For example, www.omadanetworks.com.

dgafDisable.description:
Whether to enable DGAF(downstream group-addressed forwarding) disable mode.
In DGAF disable mode, the AP will not forward downstream multicast and broadcast packets.

heSsid.description:
Homogenous Extended Service Set Identifier, it is used to identify the same type of ESS network set.
Note: HESSID should be consistent with one of the BSSIDs of the APs in the zone.

internet.description: Internet access support status (network reachability), which indicates that the network is allowed to access the Internet.

availabilityIpv4.description:
Available type information of IPv4 addresses.
Parameter availabilityIpv4 should be a value as follows: [0: Address type not available; 1: Public IPv4 address available; 2: Port-restricted IPv4 address available; 3: Single NATed private IPv4 address available; 4: Double NATed private IPv4 address available; 5: Port-restricted IPv4 address and single NATed IPv4 address available; 6: Port-restricted IPv4 address and double NATed IPv4 address available; 7: Availability of the address type is not known].

availabilityIpv6.description:
Available type information of IPv6 addresses.
Parameter availabilityIpv6 should be a value as follows: [0: Address type not available; 1: Address type available; 2: Availability of the address type not known].

operatorFriendly.description:
Hotspot network operator friendly name.
Note:Parameter operatorFriendly should contain between 1 and 64 visible ASCII characters, with no Spaces at the beginning and end, and Spaces in between.

realmList.description:
Add a profile to identify and describe a NAI (Network Access Identifier) realm accessible using the AP, and the method that this NAI realm uses for authentication.
Note: Up to 10 entries are allowed for the NAI Realm list.

HotspotV2SettingOpenApiVO.description:
Hotspot 2.0 is a WFA (Wi-Fi Alliance) technical specification based on IEEE 802.11u protocol.
It provides a simplified mechanism for wireless clients to discover and connect to suitable networks and switch seamlessly between mobile networks and wireless networks.

name.description: SSID name. It should contain 1 to 32 UTF-8 characters.

band.description: SSID band. The lowest bit indicates whether 2.4G is included; the second lowest bit indicates whether 5G is included; the third lowest bit indicates whether 6G is included; 1 means included while 0 means not included. For example, 7(111) means that 2G/5G/6G are enabled; 1(001) means that 2G is enabled. (When 5G is includedit means 5G/5G1/5G2 are enabled.)

guestNetEnable.description: SSID guest network config status. True: enable, false: disable.

security.description: SSID security mode; Security should be a value as follows: 0: None; 2: WPA-Enterprise; 3: WPA-Personal; 4: PPSK without RADIUS; 5: PPSK with RADIUS.

oweEnable.description: Opportunistic Wireless Encryption, also known as Enhanced Open, is a certification provided by the Wi-Fi Alliance as part of the WPA3 wireless security standard. OWE will enable two wireless VAPs per radio, one for access of OWE-supported stations, and one for access of other stations. An SSID with OWE enabled will be counted as two SSID entries for 2G and 5G.

broadcast.description: SSID broadcast config status. True: enable, false: disable.

vlanEnable.description: SSID VLAN config status. True: enable, false: disable.

vlanId.description: SSID VLAN ID. This field is required when Parameter [vlanEnable] is true; It should be within the range of 14094.

hidePwd.description: If this field is true, the SSID password will be hidden.

mloEnable.description: SSID MLO config status. True: enable, false: disable.

pmfMode.description: SSID PMF mode. It should be a value as follows: 1: Mandatory; 2: Capable; 3: Disable.

enable11r.description: SSID 802.11r config status. True: enable, false: disable.

deviceType.description: SSID device type, identify which devices this SSID will take effect. The lowest bit indicates whether [EAP] is included, the second low bit indicates whether [Gateway] is included, 1 means included while 0 means not included; For example, 3(11) means that EAP/Gateway is enabled, 1(01) means that EAP is enabled.

prohibitWifiShare.description: SSID prohibitWifiShare config status. True: enable, false: disable.

dhcpEnable.description: SSID DHCP Option 82 global config status. True: enable, false: disable.

format.description: SSID DHCP Option 82 format config; It should be a value as follows: 0: ASCII; 1: Binary.

delimiter.description: SSID DHCP Option 82 delimiter config (A single arbitrary ASCII character is acceptable).

circuitId.description: SSID DHCP Option 82 Circuit-ID config. Circuit-ID is an array formed in the selected order, with each array element corresponding to the following enumeration values: 1: VLAN-ID; 2: AP Radio Mac-Address; 3: SSID-Type; 4: SSID-Name; 5: AP Ethernet MAC address; 6: Site-Name. As in the example [3,1,2,4], the following enumeration values are selected sequentially on the page: SSID-Type, VLAN-ID, AP Radio Mac-Address and SSID-Name.

items.description: SSID DHCP Option 82 Circuit-ID config. Circuit-ID is an array formed in the selected order, with each array element corresponding to the following enumeration values: 1: VLAN-ID; 2: AP Radio Mac-Address; 3: SSID-Type; 4: SSID-Name; 5: AP Ethernet MAC address; 6: Site-Name. As in the example [3,1,2,4], the following enumeration values are selected sequentially on the page: SSID-Type, VLAN-ID, AP Radio Mac-Address and SSID-Name.

remoteId.description: SSID DHCP Option 82 Remote-ID config. Remote-ID is an array formed in the selected order, with each array element corresponding to the following enumeration values: 1: VLAN-ID; 2: AP Radio Mac-Address; 3: SSID-Type; 4: SSID-Name; 5: AP Ethernet MAC address; 6: Site-Name. As in the example [3,1,2,4], the following enumeration values are selected sequentially on the page: SSID-Type, VLAN-ID, AP Radio Mac-Address and SSID-Name.

items.description: SSID DHCP Option 82 Remote-ID config. Remote-ID is an array formed in the selected order, with each array element corresponding to the following enumeration values: 1: VLAN-ID; 2: AP Radio Mac-Address; 3: SSID-Type; 4: SSID-Name; 5: AP Ethernet MAC address; 6: Site-Name. As in the example [3,1,2,4], the following enumeration values are selected sequentially on the page: SSID-Type, VLAN-ID, AP Radio Mac-Address and SSID-Name.

macFilterEnable.description: SSID MAC Filter global config status. True: enable, false: disable.

policy.description: SSID MAC Filter policy config mode; It should be a value as follows: 0: Deny List, 1: Allow List.

macFilterId.description: This field represents MAC Group Profile ID. MAC Group Profile can be created using Create a new group profile interface, and MAC Group Profile ID can be obtained from Get group profile list by type interface.

ouiProfileIdList.description: This field represents OUI Profile ID list. OUI Profile can be created using Create OUI profile interface, and OUI Profile ID can be obtained from Get OUI profile summary list interface.

items.description: This field represents OUI Profile ID list. OUI Profile can be created using Create OUI profile interface, and OUI Profile ID can be obtained from Get OUI profile summary list interface.

multiCastEnable.description: Whether to enable multicast to unicast, which is enabled by default. True: enable, false: disable.

ipv6CastEnable.description: Whether to enable IPv6 multicast to unicast, which is enabled by default. True: enable, false: disable.

channelUtil.description: This item indicates that when the channel utilization reaches the threshold, multicast will no longer be converted to unicast, the default threshold is 100, and the value should be within the range of 0-100.

arpCastEnable.description: Whether to enable ARP cast to unicast, which is enabled by default. True: enable, false: disable.

filterEnable.description: Whether to enable the multicast filter switch, which is disabled by default. True: enable, false: disable.

filterMode.description: This item indicates the status of the filtering protocol. The lowest bit indicates whether IGMP is enabled; the second lowest bit indicates whether MDNS is enabled; and the third lowest bit indicates whether Others is enabled. 1 means enable while 0 means disable. For example, 7(111) means that all are enabled; 1(001) means that only IGMP is enabled.

higherDensity2g.description: 2.4GHz Data Rate Control higher density value(Unit: Mbps); It should be a value as follows: [54].

wan.description: The ID of WAN port to which this Bandwidth Control applies.

destStartPort.description: The start port of Destination Port Range. It must be less than the end port. It should be within the range of 0-65535 when protocol is 0(TCP), 1(UDP) or 2(TCP/UDP).

destEndPort.description: The end port of Destination Port Range. It must be more than the start port. It should be within the range of 0-65535 when protocol is 0(TCP), 1(UDP) or 2(TCP/UDP).

code.description: The code cannot be null and should be within the range of 0-255 when protocol is 3(ICMP).

apn.description:
Access point name, only for apnType static, should contain 1 to 64 characters and should meet the following requirements:
    1. Should not start with "rac", "lac", "sgsn" or "rnc" and end with ".gprs", ignoring case.
    2. Should not contain ".*.", ".-", "-." and spaces.
    3. Should not contain any of the characters #!$%^&*(),:;"'|\@.

0No Authentication; 1Simple Password;
2: External Radius Server; 4External Portal Server;
11Hotspot; 15: Ldap.

landingPage.description:
LandingPage enum, should be a value as follows: 1: Redirect to the original URL, 2: Redirect to Promotional URL.
With The Original URL selected, clients are directed to the URL they request for after they pass Portal authentication.
With The Promotional URL selected, clients are directed to the specified URL here after they pass Portal authentication.

defaultLanguage.description:
The controller automatically adjusts the language displayed on the Portal page according to the system language of the clients. If the language is not supported, the controller will use the default language specified here. DefaultLanguage should be a value as follows:
1: en_US (English); 3: cs_CZ (esk); 4: de_DE (Deutsch); 5: da_DK (Dansk); 6: el_GR ();
7: fr_FR (Franais); 8: es_ES (Espaol); 9: nl_NL (Nederlands); 10: it_IT (Italiano); 11: pl_PL (Polski);
12: pt_PT (Portugus); 13: ru_RU (); 14: sv_SE (Svenska); 15: tr_TR (Trke);
16: ar_SA ( );
17: ja_JP (); 18: zh_TW (()); 19: th_TH (); 20: vi_VN (Ting Vit); 21: ko_KR ()

deadInterval.description: The dead interval for the specified interface in seconds. This specifies how long a router will wait to see a neighbor router's Hello packets before declaring that the router is down. This parameter must be the same for all routers attached to a network.
